did.abstract: Two deeds for land in Oyster Bay, Nassau County, N.Y. (at the time part of Queens County). The first deed, dated 1837, is from Richard H. and Edward Pearsall to James V. Duryea, and the second deed, dated 1877, is from Duryea and his wife, Jane, to Phebe Amelia Van Cott.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1981.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: The Duryea family were a multigenerational Brooklyn family of Dutch origin. The family's earliest ancestor in the region, Joost Duryea, settled in the town of New Utrecht, Kings County as early as 1672.
